author: Annie Petito
title: Skillet-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Maple Syrup and Smoked Almonds
ingredients: 1 pound small (1 to 1 1/2 inches in diameter) brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions_list: Arrange Brussels sprouts in single layer, cut sides down, in 12-inch nonstick skillet. Drizzle oil evenly over sprouts. Cover skillet, place over medium-high heat, and cook until sprouts are bright green and cut sides have started to brown, about 5 minutes.

Uncover and continue to cook until cut sides of sprouts are deeply and evenly browned and paring knife slides in with little to no resistance, 2 to 3 minutes longer, adjusting heat and moving sprouts as necessary to prevent them from overbrowning. While sprouts cook, combine syrup, vinegar, and Â¼ teaspoon salt in small bowl.
Off heat, add syrup-vinegar mixture to skillet and stir to evenly coat sprouts. Season with salt to taste. Transfer sprouts to large plate, sprinkle with almonds, and serve.
description: Skillet Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Maple Syrup and Smoked Almonds: A savory and slightly sweet dish, enriched with the crunch of almonds.
